author: Matthew Horwood
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree said he has recused himself from files on national security issues relating to two groups in the Tamil community. During Question Period on June 12, Conservative MP Frank Caputo questioned Anandasangaree about why the minister recused himself, and whether the ethics commissioner was consulted prior to his department setting up […]
title: Public Safety Minister Recuses Himself From Files on 2 Organizations Linked to Tamil Community

author: Savannah Hulsey Pointer
description: Police say it's unclear whether the passenger jumped before or after the plane made impact.
title: Sole Survivor of Air India Crash Escaped by Jumping From Emergency Exit: Police

author: Chandra Philip
description: A herd of 50 goats is being used by the City of Toronto to clean up invasive species of vegetation as an eco-friendly way to manage the area. It is the second year the city has used the goats to reduce unwanted plants and weeds in the Don Valley Brick Works Park, and the idea […]
title: Herd of Goats Helps City of Toronto Manage Invasive Plant Species

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: India Plane Crash, London’s Personalized Museum, and Flooding in San Antonio

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Canadians want Ottawa to cut back on government spending, according to a new poll. Conducted by Leger and commissioned by the Canadian Taxpayers Federation, the poll indicated that 45 percent of Canadians say the federal government should reduce its spending over the next four years. Meanwhile, 20 percent of Canadians said spending should be increased, 19 […]
title: Plurality of Canadians Favour Lower Government Spending: Poll

author: Chris Summers
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition won a vote—which could have led to new elections—by 61–53 in the Knesset.
title: Netanyahu Survives Knesset Vote Over Military Conscription Bill

author: Alicia Márquez
description: The hospital where Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay is being treated released another update on his condition on June 11, following an attempted assassination that saw him shot during an election campaign event. The University Hospital Fundación Santa Fe in Bogotá, Colombia, published the latest report on the condition of the Democratic Center party’s […]
title: Hospital Reports Signs of ‘Neurological Improvement’ in Colombian Presidential Candidate Miguel Uribe

author: Andrew Moran
description: Boeing has rallied this year as investors turned optimistic after a years-long hit to the company's reputation.
title: Boeing Shares Fall 4 Percent After Air India Dreamliner Crash Sparks Safety Concerns

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government is defending its plans to push its internal trade and major projects bill through the House of Commons next week at a rapid clip. Critics claim the move will evade much-needed scrutiny of a bill that would give cabinet sweeping powers to quickly approve selected major natural resource projects, such as oil […]
title: Liberals to Cut Short Study of Bill to Speed up Resource Project Approvals

author: Dorothy Li
description: 'Such unusual approaches by Chinese military aircraft could potentially cause accidental collisions,' the Japanese ministry said.
title: Tokyo Says Chinese Fighter Jet Came Within 50 Yards of Japanese Patrol Aircraft

author: Josh Spasaro
description: Bernie Free says government support may not be enough.
title: ‘Pretty Dire’: Victorian Farmer Says Its the Worst Drought He’s Seen in 30 Years

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A Salmonella outbreak in Ontario and Alberta that has led to the hospitalization of seven people has been linked to the recall of three varieties of salami products available in both provinces, Canada’s public health agency says. A total of 57 laboratory-confirmed cases of Salmonella have been associated with the outbreak, including 13 confirmed cases […]
title: 7 Hospitalized in Ontario, Alberta After Consuming Salami Recalled Over Salmonella Risk

author: The Canadian Press
description: Quebec police have arrested several people alleged to be important members of Montreal’s Mafia, including the presumed head of the Rizzuto crime family. Montreal and provincial police arrested 11 men Thursday morning in what they are calling one of the most important police strikes in recent decades. “The indictment of these individuals will certainly have […]
title: Police Make Arrests in Major Operation Targeting Montreal’s Italian Mafia

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Quebec Senator Larry Smith has rejoined the Conservatives’ Senate caucus after switching to the non-affiliated Canadian Senators Group for nearly three years. Smith is the third senator to join the Conservative caucus this month. Leader of the Opposition in the Senate, Conservative Sen. Leo Housakos, welcomed Smith in a June 12 statement. “Senator Smith is […]
title: Larry Smith Latest Senator to Join Tory Caucus, Marking a Return

author: Guy Birchall
description: Big names from the worlds of politics, tech, and finance are gathering for the 71st meeting of the secretive group in Stockholm.
title: Bilderberg Meeting Begins in Sweden

author: The Canadian Press
description: Federal Jobs Minister Patty Hajdu said Thursday she’s putting Canada Post’s latest offers to unionized postal workers up for a vote in the hope of breaking a long-standing impasse between the parties. She said in a social media post it’s in the “public interest” to give members of the Canadian Union of Postal Workers an […]
title: Ottawa Puts Latest Canada Post Offer up to a Vote by Union Members

author: Jack Phillips
description: The alerts come as Trump said on June 11 that Iran 'cannot have' a nuclear weapon.
title: US Embassies in Iraq, Israel Issue Warnings Amid Regional Tensions

author: Nicole James
description: Knock on wood, cross your fingers, and hope for cake.
title: Your Friday the 13th Survival Guide

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Liberal government’s planned removal of the GST for first-time homebuyers could have the unintended effect of leading to higher prices for new homes, according to an economic analysis by Desjardins. The government has introduced legislation eliminating the GST on new homes valued up to $1 million and reducing the GST on new homes between […]
title: GST Removal Could Unintentionally Raise New Home Prices: Economic Report

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canada has been named the top preferred oil supplier among G7 nations, according to a newly released poll. When asked to evaluate eight potential suppliers, participants from G7 countries placed Canada among the top three 68 percent of the time, making it the most frequently ranked supplier out of the options available, the Ipsos poll […]
title: G7 Nations Favour Canada as Their Primary Oil Provider, Poll Finds

author: Guy Birchall
description: The UK's Office for National Statistics said that April witnessed the largest drop in exports to the United States since 1997.
title: British Exports to US Suffer Record Slump as Tariffs Take Effect

author: PA Media
description: The Air India flight was carrying more than 240 people when it collided with a medical college on Thursday.
title: British Man Survives Gatwick-Bound Ahmedabad Plane Crash: Reports

author: Phil Gurski
description: Commentary As a nation of immigrants, Canada has served as a refuge for all kinds of people who came here for all kinds of reasons. Some simply wanted a better life for themselves and their families. Some were fleeing war or conflict zones. Some came as students and decided to stay and contribute to our […]
title: Canada Has to Get Serious About Foreign Threats to Citizens

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The six largest banks in Canada have enrolled in a federal program to provide basic accounts at a cost of $4 per month to customers beginning Dec. 1. The goal of the program is to improve the affordability and accessibility of routine banking services, especially as more Canadians bank online, the Financial Consumer Agency of […]
title: Canada’s Major Banks to Offer $4 Chequing Accounts by Dec. 1

author: The Canadian Press
description: Newfoundland and Labrador is owed millions of dollars in fees from green energy companies, underlining growing doubts about whether promises of major projects and multi-billion dollar investments will pan out. Six companies are vying to create new operations in the province that would use wind energy to produce hydrogen for exports overseas. Figures obtained by […]
title: Some Newfoundland Hydrogen Companies Behind in Bills as Industry Hype ‘Boils Off’

author: The Canadian Press
description: One Canadian was on the London-bound Air India flight that crashed with more than 240 people on board shortly after takeoff, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Thursday. The plane crashed Thursday in a residential area of India’s northwestern city of Ahmedabad, a city of more than five million people. Local police say there are no […]
title: One Canadian Aboard Air India Flight That Crashed Just After Takeoff

author: The Canadian Press
description: Statistics Canada says the amount Canadians owe relative to their income ticked higher in the first quarter as debt grew faster than income. The agency says the ratio of household credit market debt to disposable income rose to 173.9 percent on a seasonally adjusted basis, up from 173.5 percent in the fourth quarter of 2024. […]
title: Statistics Canada Reports Household Debt-to-Income Ratio Ticked Higher in Q1

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced that £6 billion of NHS funds will be used to deliver up to 4 million additional NHS tests, scans, and procedures.
title: UK Turning Into ‘National Health State,’ Says Think Tank

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The former CEO of the Canadian subsidiary of China’s largest bank says he was instructed to “ignore” Canadian law and “circumvent” Canadian regulators, alleging he was fired for not following these directions. Lubin Wang, 51, former head of ICBK, the Canadian subsidiary of the state-owned Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC), China’s largest bank, […]
title: Ex-CEO Claims China’s Top Bank Told Him to ‘Ignore’ Canadian Law

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The new agreement with the European Union aims to remove border checks and secure trade, but critics warn of Chagos precedent.
title: UK Agrees Deal on Gibraltar’s Post-Brexit Future Amid Sovereignty Debate

author: Chris Summers
description: The determination by the U.N. nuclear watchdog's board of governors comes as the U.S. State Department warned of a heightened security risk in the Middle East.
title: Iran in Breach of Nuclear Non-Proliferation Duties, Says Watchdog

author: Epoch Video
description: Aftermath of an Air India plane crash near the airport in India’s western city of Ahmedabad on June 12. There were more than 200 people on board. SCHEDULE: 6:38 ET – Exterior of Ahmedabad Civil Hospital (LIVE) 7:33 ET – View of the tail of the plane stuck in a building (LIVE) 8:02 ET – […]
title: View From Hospital After Air India Plane Crashes in Ahmedabad

author: Carolina Avendano, Jan Jekielek
description: From manufacturing fentanyl precursors, to operating unofficial Chinese police stations on Western soil, to recruiting academics abroad to gain access to foreign technologies needed to advance Beijing’s goals, China’s infiltration of North America runs “deep,” says a Canadian investigative journalist. The problem of China’s operations in Canada drew renewed attention last month when FBI Director […]
title: China’s Infiltration of North America Runs ‘Deep,’ Says Canadian Investigative Journalist

author: Matthew Horwood
description: News Analysis There is currently momentum in Canada to grow the economy through major projects, including around energy, but the jury is still out on whether enough can be done to reform regulations to attract the necessary investments. While investments in Canada’s oil and gas sector fell alongside oil prices since 2014, investments in the […]
title: How Government Regulations Have Affected Oil and Gas Sector Investments

author: PA Media
description: The chairman of Air India described the incident as a 'tragic accident' and a 'devastating event.'
title: 53 British Nationals Abord Gatwick-Bound Plane That Crashed in India

author: Owen Evans
description: The Air India flight, a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, crashed into a residential area five minutes after take off.
title: Passenger Plane Carrying 244 Crashes in India Shortly After Takeoff

author: Alex Wu
description: Dr. Zheng Zhi warns Taiwanese people of the plan at a screening of award winning documentary 'State Organ' in Taiwan.
title: Former Chinese Military Doctor Leaks CCP Plan to Use Taiwanese Troops as Organ Bank

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The Fair Work Commission has found the university underpaid around 5,500 employees who worked between 2015 and 2024 across its south-east Queensland campuses.
title: Griffith University to Repay $8 Million to Thousands of Staff After Fair Work Probe

author: Alfred Bui
description: Queensland Police Minister Dan Purdie said the new law was one critical step closer to ensuring a safer community.
title: Queensland Makes Public Weapon Search Law Permanent

author: Reuters
description: KHARKIV, Ukraine—A concentrated, nine-minute-long Russian drone attack on Ukraine’s second-largest city of Kharkiv on Wednesday killed six people and injured 64, including nine children, Ukrainian officials said. The attack followed Russia’s two biggest air assaults of the war on Ukraine this week, part of intensified bombardments that Moscow says are retaliatory measures for Kyiv’s recent […]
title: Russia Hits Ukraine’s Kharkiv With Deadly Nighttime Barrage of Drones

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Moira Deeming offered a deal seeking her preselection in exchange for easing former Liberal leader John Pesutto’s legal debt of $2.3 million.
title: Liberal MP Referred to Anti-Corruption Watchdog Over Alleged Preselection Bargain

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Consumer advocacy group Choice tested 20 sunscreens and found only four met their SPF 50 claims.
title: Consumers Getting Burned by Dubious Sunscreen Claims, Advocacy Group Finds

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The teen died after an e-scooter crash into a parked car. Police urge witnesses or dashcam holders to contact Policelink.
title: Teen Dies in Mareeba E-Scooter Crash, 5th Queensland Fatality This Year

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: As part of a global blitz, ASIC joined regulators from 8 nations to crack down on unlicensed influencers promoting risky financial advice online.
title: Global Crackdown Puts 18 ‘Finfluencers’ on Notice for Risky Financial Advice

author: The Associated Press
description: At least 49 people have died in flooding in South Africa’s Eastern Cape province after an extreme cold front brought heavy rain and snow to parts of the country
title: At Least 49 People Have Died in Flooding in South Africa, Officials Say

author: Reuters
description: GRAZ, Austria—Austria came to a standstill on Wednesday to mourn victims of one of the worst outbreaks of violence in its modern history, as authorities search for clues to why a 21-year-old gunman shot dead 10 people at his former high school before killing himself. Police said the man had acted alone in Tuesday’s rampage, […]
title: Austria Comes to a Standstill to Mourn School Shooting Victims

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Almost a quarter of a tonne of cocaine has been seized at the Australian border, but to date no arrests have been made.
title: Police Seek Help After 250 Kilograms of Cocaine Seized in Brisbane

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Since its inception in 2021, the AUKUS trilateral security partnership has focused heavily on providing Australia with more advanced nuclear-powered submarines.
title: Pentagon Reviewing Submarine Defense Partnership With UK and Australia

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The chief minister says the move will help reduce crime and restore community safety, but studies are yet to prove this.
title: Pepper Spray to Become Legal for Civilian Use in the Northern Territory

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Monash IVF implanted wrong embryos in two cases—one in Brisbane, where a child was born without genetic ties, and another in Clayton on June 5.
title: Monash IVF CEO Resigns After Second Embryo Error

author: John Carpay
description: Commentary A friend of mine is German Canadian. He was born in Germany, came to Canada at the age of 5, and speaks German fluently today. My own story is similar: I was born in the Netherlands, came to Canada at the age of 7, and speak Dutch fluently. He and I are friends, but […]
title: Race-Based Policies Inevitably Produce Inter-Ethnic Animosity

author: Scott McGregor
description: Commentary As Canada navigates a shifting geopolitical landscape shaped by trade tensions, great power rivalry, and mounting hybrid threats, a pressing question looms: Should Canada decouple from authoritarian regimes, particularly China, or pursue a policy of strategic derisking? The answer will define our national security, economic sovereignty, and credibility among democratic allies. The terms “decoupling” […]
title: Derisking vs. Decoupling: A Critical Choice for Canada in a Time of Global Realignment and China’s Increasing Threat

author: Tom Ozimek
description: The remarks came during a Senate hearing on U.S. military posture and threats posed by America's rivals.
title: Putin Won’t Stop at Ukraine, Says Chair of Joint Chiefs of Staff

author: Noé Chartier
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said the head of Quebec’s public utility company Hydro-Québec, Michael Sabia, will become the new Clerk of the Privy Council, the highest ranking civil servant in the government. Carney said Sabia’s vast experience in the public and private sectors will help his government fulfill its objective to build the “strongest economy […]
title: Carney Appoints Hydro-Québec Head Michael Sabia to Lead Public Service

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Australia's Defence Minister Richard Marles says he is confident AUKUS will still go ahead.
title: AUKUS Under Review as US Weighs Alignment With ‘America First’ Doctrine

description: The State Department has ordered the departure of nonessential personnel from Baghdad and authorized a voluntary departure from Bahrain and Kuwait.
title: US Reduces Presence at Middle East Embassies Amid Rising Tensions

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis Major players on the international stage will be descending on Canada next week for the G7 Summit, which is already rich in storylines before even kicking off. A sizable amount of new baggage exists between some of the leaders, and the event will also feature many fresh faces. Among the seven-member countries of […]
title: What to Expect From the G7 Summit in Canada
